Sesame Street is a popular children's television program that features a cast of characters that are mostly puppets or muppets. 

Next, we need to determine if Elmo was an original character on Sesame Street. To do this, we need to know when Sesame Street first aired. The show premiered on November 10, 1969. 

Now we need to investigate when Elmo was first introduced on the show. Elmo did not appear on Sesame Street until the mid-1970s as a minor character. He was first developed as a character called "Baby Monster" and evolved over time to become the lovable, furry red creature we know today. 

Based on these facts, we can conclude that Elmo was not an original muppet character on Sesame Street, as he was not introduced until several years after the show first premiered. Therefore, the correct answer is (B) no.
